definition: to plan a project/to stand on tiptoe/Taiwan pr. [qi4]/abbr. for 企業|企业[qi3 ye4]
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: These small businesses have benefited greatly from the fall in interest rates.
sentences.chinese: 小企业应利率下降而获得了很年夜的好处。

sentences.english: Small and medium-sized firm should make brand decision based on the concrete international market environment.
sentences.chinese: 中小企业应根据具体国际市场环境进行品牌决策。

sentences.english: Currently, the SBG has an active group of 60+ members.
sentences.chinese: 现在，小企业有60多个活跃的成员。

sentences.english: As Jen Grant pointed out to us, these are usually small to medium-sized businesses, or groups within larger enterprises. The new features in Box.
sentences.chinese: 新推出的功能将帮助中小企业更好地开展业务。

sentences.english: This way he thinks he can support small businesses, helping to provide employment opportunities for small stallholders.
sentences.chinese: 他认为，自己能给许多小企业和小摊贩提供工作机会。

sentences.english: The importance of small business to the US economy is overwhelming.
sentences.chinese: 中小企业对美国经济的重要性是明显的。

sentences.english: This will allow SMEseven more chance to target or network with specific customers.
sentences.chinese: 这也将使中小企业有更多的机会网罗更多的特殊用户。

sentences.english: We shall try to solve the financing difficulty of service outsourcing enterprises, especially the small- and medium-sized ones.
sentences.chinese: 努力解决服务外包企业特别是中小企业融资难的问题。

sentences.english: The company has sold off a number of loss-making operations and found ways of amalgamating smaller plants.
sentences.chinese: 企业卖掉了亏本的生产线，试图寻求合并小企业。

sentences.english: The healthy development of small and medium-sized enterprises calls for the support from a sound legal system.
sentences.chinese: 中小企业的健康发展依赖完善的法律制度支持。

sentences.english: Tom's computer shop was incorporated in Hong Kong, which is a small business.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆的电脑店在香港成立，这是一个小企业。

sentences.english: The financing problem has now become a choke point in developing small and middle-sized enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 融资难已经成为了制约中小企业发展的“瓶颈”。

sentences.english: The arrival of high-cost era brought the threat for the development of small and medium-sized enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 高成本时代的到来给中小企业的发展带来了威胁。

sentences.english: A bank may introduce syndicated loans in the granting of credits to small enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 银行可引入银团贷款方式提供小企业授信服务。

sentences.english: ABAC declare a boost to the development of minor enterprises.
sentences.chinese: ABAC发宣言助推中小企业发展。

sentences.english: IV. Scientifically examining and timely disposing of the non-performing loans of small enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 要科学考核和及时处置小企业不良贷款。

definition: private business/opposite: state-owned enterprise 國有企業|国有企业[guo2 you3 qi3 ye4]
abbr. for 外商獨資企業|外商独资企业[wai4 shang1 du2 zi1 qi3 ye4]
foreign enterprise/company established in mainland China with direct investment from foreign entities or from investors in Taiwan, Macao or Hong Kong/abbr. for 外資企業|外资企业
state enterprise/(Tw) abbr. for 國際企業管理|国际企业管理, international business management (as a subject of study)
